snippet: Computer and video games inspired by social issues and real-life events — drone strikes, child labor in Uzbekistan and child abuse by clergy — are a growing segment of the industry.

snippet: While some in the G.O.P. aim to scar the Obama administration, Representative Dave Camp is hoping to turn voter anger into an effort to change the tax system.
abstract: Some Republican lawmakers aim to use Internal Revenue Service scandal to scar Obama administration, but Rep Dave Camp and others are hoping to turn voter anger into catalyst for overhauling tax code.

snippet: The government presented evidence that executives of big book publishing companies discussed raising e-book prices at Apple’s behest before the introduction of the iPad.
abstract: Justice Department, in antitrust case against Apple, says there were 100 phone calls among top executives of publishing industry in weeks leading up to Apple's iPad introduction in 2010, when they had to decide whether to sign on to deal with firm that would raise prices of e-books.

headline.main: U.S. Cites Phone Calls in Apple Pricing Case
headline.print_headline: U.S. Cites Phone Calls In Apple Pricing Case

snippet: The family of the chief executive of a large development company in Beijing teamed up with a Brazilian family long involved in international banking to buy a 40-percent stake in the building.
abstract: Family of Zhang Xin, chief executive of large development company in China, and the Safra family of Brazil, long involved in international banking, team up to buy 40 percent stake in Midtown Manhattan's General Motors Building; deal increases worth of building, already the most valuable office tower in the United States, to $3.4 billion.

headline.main: Chinese Developer Gets Minority Stake in G.M. Building
headline.print_headline: Chinese Developer Gets Minority Stake in G.M. Building
